Image_title: Scheeps Togt Van Iamaica Gedaan na Panuco en Rio de las Palmas Aan de Golf van Mexico Gelegen.
Description: Map of the Caribbean islands and the Gulf of Mexico. Also includes Florida and the east coast of Mexico and the Yucatan. Cartographic elements include scales, degrees of latitude and longitude, some topographical details, location of rivers and some settlements. Includes men and horses swimming to an island from a shipwreck. Also includes men hunting turtles.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1519 tot 1521
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, Drie verscheyde togten ter see en te land in de West-Indien ... , Leiden, 1707.This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. The voyages covering the period from 1246 to 1696 are arranged chronologically.

Image_title: [Bodies burn in a city square]
Description: Bodies chained together burn in a city square. Other chained prisoners wait their turn. Also includes soldiers holding the prisoners, men putting wood on the fire, fortifications, and spears.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1519 tot 1521
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: Text discusses execution of native Americans under the leadership of Francisco de Garay in the Pánuco River region. Garay lost his life in the dispute with Hernan Cortes over the control of the area between south of Tampico and east to present-day Alabama.This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, Drie verscheyde togten ter see en te land in de West-Indien ... , Leiden, 1707.This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. The voyages covering the period from 1246 to 1696 are arranged chronologically.

Image_title: [Murder of a Spaniard in his bedroom]
Description: A Spanish gentleman is attacked in his bedroom by three men. One man holds the gentleman who was eating a meal. Another man stabs him with a knife. Includes hanging lamp, table with fruit and fallen vessel or urn, and cupboard.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1524 tot 1526
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: Cristóbal de Olid was directed by Hernán Cortés to establish a colony in Honduras. Instead, Olid declared himself governor and Cortés was forced to attack him and his forces. Cortés' lieutenant, Francisco de las Casas, and his men attacked Olid with a knife after supper; afterwards, to legitimize their execution of Olid, his dead body was beheaded in the market place.This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, Twee onderscheydene reys-togten d'eene ter zee en d'andere te land in de West-Indien ... , Leiden, 1706.This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. The voyages covering the period from 1246 to 1696 are arranged chronologically.

Image_title: [Cortés directs his men to build a bridge]
Description: Cortés looks at a map held by another man and directs his army. In the background men chop trees, make the logs into planks, and carry planks to build a bridge across a river. Includes horses, axes, guns or muskets, baton, sword, and catapault [?].
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1524 tot 1526
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: Hernán Cortés and his army made their way to Huatecpan [Cihuatecpan in the Teotihuacán valley?] in the province of Acalan using a compass and a chart he had with him. When their way was impeded by a deep river, Cortés set his men to build a bridge. There was mutinous talk but, in the end, the bridge was built.This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, Twee verscheyde scheeps-togten gedaan na de Moluccos en St. Martha ... , Leiden, 1707.This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. The voyages covering the period from 1246 to 1696 are arranged chronologically.

Image_title: [Spaniards hang native Americans]
Description: Spanish soldiers force a native American to climb a ladder. Two other natives hang, executed, from a gallows. A native American wearing a feathered headdress shows a paper with heads drawn on it to a soldier riding a horse. Includes spears.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1524 tot 1526
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: Hernán Cortés and his army had captured one of the Mexican chiefs or caciques and kept him as hostage against the Mexicans who were planning a revolt against the Spanish. One of the Mexicans, who was later called Don Christoffel [Cristobal], discovered the plan and drew a picture of the parties involved in it. The three caciques, Quautimoc, Tlacatlec, and Tetepanquizatl, were hanged. Their execution terrorized the natives so that they submitted to Spanish rule.This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, Twee verscheyde scheeps-togten gedaan na de Moluccos en St. Martha ... , Leiden, 1707.This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. The voyages covering the period from 1246 to 1696 are arranged chronologically.

Image_title: [Cortés walks in the pouring rain]
Description: Hernán Cortés walks in pouring rain with a pike or spear over his shoulder. Spanish soldiers carry sick men on litters and administer to their wounds. Other men huddle in shelters. In the background horses and men fall off of steep mountains.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1524 tot 1526
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: Hernán Cortés and his army attempted to march through a mountain pass, but continual rains and the want of provisions caused 68 horses to be lost and many men. To encourage the men's morale, Cortés walked about in the rain, tended the sick, and distributed what little provisions were left.This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, Twee verscheyde scheeps-togten gedaan na de Moluccos en St. Martha ... , Leiden, 1707.This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. The voyages covering the period from 1246 to 1696 are arranged chronologically.

Image_title: [Spaniards torture native Americans]
Description: Spanish soldiers hang a man and chop off the hands and feet of native Americans. Includes axes, spears, guns or muskets, and gallows.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1524 tot 1526
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: Text discusses the treatment of native Americans in Mexico by the Spanish.This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, Twee verscheyde scheeps-togten gedaan na de Moluccos en St. Martha ... , Leiden, 1707.This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. The voyages covering the period from 1246 to 1696 are arranged chronologically.

Image_title: [Native Americans massacre Spanish]
Description: Native Americans massacre Europeans in their beds. In the backgound are a horse stable and dwellings on fire. Men stab into sacks of grain with swords. Also includes bows, arrows, and knives.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1524 tot 1526
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: Text discusses the slaying of Juan Grijalva during an Indian uprising led by the cacique, Guatucanola, in the valley of Ulancha, Nicaragua.This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, De trotsmoedige scheeps-togt van Sebastiaan Gaboto ... , Leiden, 1707.This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. The voyages covering the period from 1246 to 1696 are arranged chronologically.

Image_title: [Native American shows a mortuary to a European]
Description: Native American shows temple or mortuary to a European. Includes bodies hung up by chains, skulls, and pots of incense [?].
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1492 tot 1499
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: Text describes the palace of Comagre, who in 1513 showed Vasco Nuñez de Balboa a room in which the dried and embalmed bodies of his ancestors were suspended from the walls, in clothes covered with precious jewels and gold. Comagre, a powerful cacique, ruled an area west of Antigua, Panama.This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, Aankomst van Jean d'Ezquebel ter Bevolking van Jamaica, door den Ammiraal Diego Kolumbus, Leiden, 1706.This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. The voyages covering the period from 1246 to 1696 are arranged chronologically.
SubjectHeadings1: Indians of Central America--First contact with Europeans

Image_title: [Native Americans bring gold and treasure to Europeans]
Description: Native Americans bring gold and treasure to Europeans. In the background, a priest baptizes a native and a native shows an explorer an ocean. Includes guns or muskets, swords, and dwellings.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1492 tot 1499
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: In 1511, Nuñez de Balboa set off to find a vast sea spoken of by the natives. On the way, his soldiers began quarrelling over some pearls which they had stolen. In disgust, the son of the cacique offered to bring the Spanish to a place where they could get more gold and where there was another ocean. Image derived from Theodor de Bry, America, Pt. IV, plate 21.This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, Aankomst van Jean d'Ezquebel ter Bevolking van Jamaica, door den Ammiraal Diego Kolumbus, Leiden, 1706.This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. The voyages covering the period from 1246 to 1696 are arranged chronologically.
SubjectHeadings1: Indians of the West Indies--First contact with Europeans

Image_title: [Native American methods of curing the sick]
Description: Native American methods of curing the sick. The sick are either laid face up or down on platforms. On one side a man sucks blood from the head of a sick man. On the other, seeds are burnt and the fumes are inhaled by the patient. One woman nurses a child and another woman who is pregnant drinks from a bowl. Two children fight or play. In the background, a woman offers tobacco to a man with a pipe.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1492 tot 1499
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: Native Americans used various methods to cure the sick. Blood was extracted from the head of a patient and that blood was placed in an earthen or gourd vessel and given to pregnant women or women who are nursing male children to drink. Sometimes the patient inhaled smoke from certain seeds or from tobacco. This image illustrates practices of the natives of Florida.This image is derived from Theodor de Bry, America, Pt. 2, plate 20.This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, Verscheide zee en land-togten gedaan in de West-Indien, Leiden, 1706.This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. The voyages covering the period from 1246 to 1696 are arranged chronologically.

Image_title: [Native Americans attack monks]
Description: Native Americans attack monks and soldiers. Includes scene of warfare, war clubs, bows, arrows, dwellings, men escaping to boats and ships.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1492 tot 1499
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: Text describes the Dominican monks, Francisco de Cordova and Juan Garcés, who went to Cumana, Venezuela, in 1514 to convert the Indians. They were executed by the natives in retaliation for Spanish kidnapping of fellow Indians some four months earlier, thus becoming the first Dominican martyrs in the New World.This image is derived from Theodor de Bry, America, Pt.4, plate 16. This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, Verscheide zee en land-togten gedaan in de West-Indien, Leiden, 1706.This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. The voyages covering the period from 1246 to 1696 are arranged chronologically.

Image_title: [Europeans attack native Americans]
Description: Europeans attack native Americans, hanging one, and decapitating and killing others with swords. Includes axe, swords, dwellings, and palisade.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1492 tot 1499
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.

Image_title: [Europeans attack native Americans]
Description: Europeans with guns or muskets attack native Americans. Includes scene of warfare, burning, bows, arrows, dwellings, and feathered headdresses.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1492 tot 1499
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: Text discusses Gaspar de Espinosa and his expedition in 1518 against natives who were under the leadership of the cacique, Cutara, in Panama.This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, Uytvoerige reys-togten door Pedrarias Davila ... naar de vaste custe van Darien, Leiden, 1706.This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. Image_title: [Europeans capture native Americans and lead them away]
Description: Europeans with spears attack native Americans and natives attack with war clubs. In the foreground Spanish soldiers lead a group of natives. Includes scene of warfare, men hanging from trees, guns or muskets, dwellings, watermill.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1492 tot 1499
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: Text discusses Tello de Guzman and his capture of the area ruled by the cacique, Comagre and his son, Pocorosa, in Panama in 1715. The image is derived from Theodor de Bry, America, Pt. 5, plate 4, where it describes slaves who attempt to escape servitude in Hispaniola; here it describes capturing natives in Panama.This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, Uytvoerige reys-togten door Pedrarias Davila ... naar de vaste custe van Darien, Leiden, 1706.This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. The voyages covering the period from 1246 to 1696 are arranged chronologically.

Image_title: [Native Americans kill alligators]
Description: Native Americans kill alligator by pushing a pole down its mouth and by beating it with clubs. Also includes bows and granary or blind for hiding from game.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1492 tot 1499
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: The image is derived from Theodor de Bry, America, Pt. 2, plate 26, where it describes alligator hunting in Florida. Men would push a pole down the alligator's mouth and force it to turn over whereupon they would shoot it with arrows in its soft belly. Here it illustrates a large alligator found in Panama.This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, Uytvoerige reys-togten door Pedrarias Davila ... naar de vaste custe van Darien, Leiden, 1706.This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. The voyages covering the period from 1246 to 1696 are arranged chronologically.

Image_title: [European soldiers behead a man]
Description: A man is executed while priest, soldiers and native Americans in the distance watch. Includes ax, dwellings, crucifix, and spears.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1492 tot 1499
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: Text discusses the execution of Vasco Nuñez de Balboa in 1519 by order of Pedrarias Dávila in Acla, a Spanish colonial town now abandoned in present-day Panama.This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, De rampspoedige scheeps-togt van Franciscus Hernandez de Cordua ter nieuwe ontedekking na Jukatan ondernomen, Leiden, 1706.This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. The voyages covering the period from 1246 to 1696 are arranged chronologically.

Image_title: [Burial ceremony of a chief]
Description: A man holding a bow lies in a hammock over a fire. Native Americans with feathered headdresses sit and stand around the fire. Includes a man playing a drum and dwellings.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1492 tot 1499
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: By December 1513, Balboa returned from the Pacific Ocean and arrived at the Caribbean coast where he found that his ally, the cacique Comagre, had died.This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, De rampspoedige scheeps-togt van Franciscus Hernandez de Cordua ter nieuwe ontedekking na Jukatan ondernomen, Leiden, 1706.This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. The voyages covering the period from 1246 to 1696 are arranged chronologically.
SubjectHeadings1: Indians of Central America--Funeral customs and rites

Image_title: [Dogs attack native Americans]
Description: Dogs attack native Americans while European soldiers watch. Includes guns or muskets.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1492 tot 1499
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: While crossing the isthmus of Panama in 1513, Vasco Nuñez de Balboa came across native Americans from the province of Quarenca, dressed as women, committing acts of sodomy. As punishment, Balboa had the men thrown to the dogs.This image is derived from Theodor de Bry, America, Pt.4, plate 22.This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, Opmerklyke zee-togten gedaan ter ontdekkinge van eilanden en vaste kusten der West-Indien, Leiden, 1706.This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. The voyages covering the period from 1246 to 1696 are arranged chronologically.

Image_title: [Native American kneels before European soldier]
Description: European soldier receives homage from native American chief or cacique.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1492 tot 1499
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: In 1513, Vasco Nuñez de Balboa captured Tubanama, a powerful and feared cacique who ruled an area in the isthmus of Panama. As ransom, Balboa received vast amounts of gold, slaves, as well as Tubanama's son as a hostage. This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, Verscheide zee en land-togten gedaan in de West-Indien, Leiden, 1706.This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. The voyages covering the period from 1246 to 1696 are arranged chronologically.

Image_title: [Native Americans are taken prisoner]
Description: Native Americans are taken prisoner. Includes men in chains, manacles, feathered headdresses, European soldiers, king or cacique sitting on a throne, and dwelling.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1492 tot 1499
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: Text discusses Gaspar de Morales and Francisco Pizarro's expeditions in 1513 to the Archipiélago de las Perlas off the coast of Panama. Over the years, the Spanish killed off the native populations and brought in African slaves to harvest pearls.This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, Uytvoerige reys-togten door Pedrarias Davila ... naar de vaste custe van Darien, Leiden, 1706.This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. The voyages covering the period from 1246 to 1696 are arranged chronologically.

Image_title: [Europeans float on rafts across a river pursued by native Americans]
Description: Europeans flee from native Americans who shoot them with arrows. Includes rafts and scenes of drowning.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1492 tot 1499
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: Text discusses the expeditions of Tello de Guzman and Francisco de Vallejo across Panama in 1515 ending at the Golfo de Uraba where many of them were killed by poison arrows shot by the natives.This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, Uytvoerige reys-togten door Pedrarias Davila ... naar de vaste custe van Darien, Leiden, 1706.This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. The voyages covering the period from 1246 to 1696 are arranged chronologically.

Image_title: [Native Americans attack Europeans]
Description: Native Americans attack Europeans and plunder their possessions. Includes a scene of cannibalism, boat, ship, and clubs.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1492 tot 1499
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: Text discusses Jean Diaz de Solis, the first European to land at Rio de la Plata in 1515, but who was killed by natives.This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, Uytvoerige reys-togten door Pedrarias Davila ... naar de vaste custe van Darien, Leiden, 1706.This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. The voyages covering the period from 1246 to 1696 are arranged chronologically.
SubjectHeadings1: Indians of South America--First contact with Europeans

Image_title: [Native American sacrifice]
Description: Two eviscerated or sacrificed men lie before an idol or god on altar in a temple. Includes Europeans who observe the sacrifice. Also includes boats.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1492 tot 1499
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: Text discusses Juan de Grijalva's travels through the Yucatan in 1518.This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, De rampspoedige scheeps-togt van Franciscus Hernandez de Cordua ter nieuwe ontedekking na Jukatan ondernomen, Leiden, 1706.This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. Image_title: [Europeans pull down an idol and erect a cross in a temple]
Description: Europeans pull down idols and break them while erecting a cross in a temple. Includes priest, men with hammers and ropes, feathered headdresses, and native Americans holding pots of incense [?].
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1492 tot 1499
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: Text discusses Hernan Cortés and his landing at Cozumel in 1519, the first point of landing by the Spanish on Mexican territory.This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, De roem-waardige zee- en land-togten door den vermaarden Ferdinandes Cortes ... gedaan na Nieuw-Spanje en Mexico, Leiden, 1706.This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. The voyages covering the period from 1246 to 1696 are arranged chronologically.
SubjectHeadings2: Indians of Mexico--First contact with Europeans

Image_title: [European soldier embraces a native American cacique]
Description: European soldier embraces a cacique or chief before native Americans and other soldiers. Includes feathered headdresses, throne, and pots or vessels.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1492 tot 1499
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: Associating the arrival of Cortés in 1519 with the prophecy of the white-skinned god Quetzalcoatl returning from the east to reclaim his authority over the Aztecs, Moctezuma initially saw Cortés arrival in 1519 as the fulfillment of the prophecy and welcomed the Spanish with lavish gifts.This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, De roem-waardige zee- en land-togten door den vermaarden Ferdinandes Cortes ... gedaan na Nieuw-Spanje en Mexico, Leiden, 1706.This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. The voyages covering the period from 1246 to 1696 are arranged chronologically.
SubjectHeadings2: Indians of Mexico--First contact with Europeans

Image_title: [Montezuma's dream]
Description: Montezuma or Moctezuma lies sleeping on the ground while an eagle carries a man in his talons and the city of Tenochtitlan burns in the distance. Includes a shooting star, three-headed idol or god, bird, men pulling loads, and other men standing on a balcony.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1492 tot 1499
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: Moctezuma was said to have dreamed of the coming of a white-skinned bearded man from the east (the god, Quetzalcoatl), a three-pronged shooting star, the destruction of Tenochtitlan by fire and flooding, strange people with many heads but one body (perhaps men on horses), and a strange bird.This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, De roem-waardige zee- en land-togten door den vermaarden Ferdinandes Cortes ... gedaan na Nieuw-Spanje en Mexico, Leiden, 1706.This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. The voyages covering the period from 1246 to 1696 are arranged chronologically.
SubjectHeadings2: Indians of Mexico--First contact with Europeans

Image_title: [Mexicans present gifts to Europeans]
Description: Native Americans present gifts of coins, clothes, toads or frogs, vessels, and jewels to a European man sitting on a throne in a stone dwelling. Also includes pots of incense [?], sun disks, feathered headdresses, and spears.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1492 tot 1499
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.

Image_title: [Native American soldiers]
Description: Native American or Mexican soldiers. In the background is a council of war. Includes shields and arrows.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1492 tot 1499
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: Text discusses the Aztec or Mexican soldiers. This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, De roem-waardige zee- en land-togten door den vermaarden Ferdinandes Cortes ... gedaan na Nieuw-Spanje en Mexico, Leiden, 1706.This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. The voyages covering the period from 1246 to 1696 are arranged chronologically.
SubjectHeadings2: Indians of Mexico--First contact with Europeans

Image_title: [European soldiers attack a native American settlement]
Description: Europeans attack a native American settlement, burning dwellings and palisades, and killing the inhabitants. Includes shields, spears, swords, pikes, and guns or muskets.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1492 tot 1499
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: The governor of Cartagena, Alonso de Ojeda [Hojeda], launched a surprise attack in 1509 in retaliation for the loss of his soldiers who were killed by native Americans on an earlier expedition to the interior of present-day Colombia to search for gold. Ojeda was aided by the arrival of Diego de Nicuesa's fleet. The settlement was burned and all its inhabitants were captured or killed.Image derived from Theodor de Bry, America, Pt. 4, plate 18.This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, Aankomst van Jean d'Ezquebel ter Bevolking van Jamaica, door den Ammiraal Diego Kolumbus, Leiden, 1706.This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. The voyages covering the period from 1246 to 1696 are arranged chronologically.
SubjectHeadings2: Indians of South America--First contact with Europeans

Image_title: [Shipbuilding]
Description: Shipbuilding in Veragua. Men saw planks and construct a ship. In the background, a shipwrecked vessel lies in the ocean, men build dwellings and sow fields. Includes boat building tools such as adzes, axes, pitch cooking over a fire, cross-saw, pliers, mallet, and anvil.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1492 tot 1499
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: Members of Diego de Nicuesa's expedition to Panama in 1509 were forced to build a new vessel re-using material from their ship which was wrecked under their commander, Lope de Olaño, who destroyed his fleet to keep his men from deserting while he looked for the mouth of the Veragua River. This ship was the first to be built by Europeans in the New World.See also Theodor de Bry's America. Pt. 4, plate 19.This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, Aankomst van Jean d'Ezquebel ter Bevolking van Jamaica, door den Ammiraal Diego Kolumbus, Leiden, 1706.This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. The voyages covering the period from 1246 to 1696 are arranged chronologically.

Image_title: [Native Americans greet Europeans and then ambush them]
Description: Europeans are greeted by native Americans who live in a settlement built above the water of a lake. Includes dwellings with causeways linking the huts. Women in canoes in the foreground paddle out to the Europeans. In the background is a scene of warfare. Also includes bows, guns or muskets, and ship.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1492 tot 1499
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: During Vespucci's voyage to America with Alonso d'Ojeda, the Spanish came to a village built on "Lake" Maracaibo. Intially the natives sent out their young women who they offered to the visitors. Then on a signal, the young women lept from the canoes and the men ambushed the Spanish. This image is derived from Theodor de Bry's America, pt. 10, plate 3. This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera, Eerste zee-togt van Alonso d'Ojeda, Leiden, 1706. This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. The voyages covering the period from 1246 to 1696 are arranged chronologically.

Image_title: [Columbus demonstrates his idea about his voyage]
Description: Christopher Columbus sits at a table with other gentlemen discusing his plans for sailing west to reach China. An egg balanced on a plate stands before him. Also includes dogs, statute, basin and ewer, gardens.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1524 tot 1526
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: Columbus supposedly showed how the impossible can be possible by demonstrating how an egg can be made to stand on end. He flattened one end and stood it on a plate. This trick originally may be attributed to Brunelleschi who was believed to have used it. This image follows the special title page for Herrera y Tordesillas, Antonio de, De roemwaardige scheeps-togt van Christoffel Kolumbus; door hem allereerst in den jare 1492 ... , Leiden, 1706. Excerpt and translation of the author's: Historia general de los hechos de los Castellanos, first printed Madrid, 1601. This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. The voyages covering the period from 1246 to 1696 are arranged chronologically.

Image_title: [Animals of Panama]
Description: Animals of Panama. Includes various fantastic animals, such as birds, a lion, jaguar [?], leopard [?], a elephant with hooves, peacock, toads, snake, monkeys, and fox or dog.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1492 tot 1499
Source_publisher: Door Pieter Vander Aa, boekverkoper in de St. Pieters Koor-steeg, in Plato.
notes: This image follows the special title page for Antonio de Herrera y Tordesillas, Uytvoerige reys-togten door Pedrarias Davila ... naar de vaste custe van Darien, Leiden, 1706.This collection of voyages consists of 127 parts, each having a special title page, separate pagination, and register. The voyages covering the period from 1246 to 1696 are arranged chronologically.

Image_title: [Cabbage tree, fish, plan of Arica, Chile, and profiles of mountains]
Description: Various views of a cabbage tree, a fish, profiles of Gallo Island and the mountain of Sama, as well as a plan of the harbor of Arica, in present-day Chile.
Source_Title: A voyage round the world. Containing an account of Captain Dampier's expedition ... Together with the author's voyage from Amapalla on the west-coast of Mexico ...
Source_publisher: Printed by W. Botham, for James Knapton, at the Crown in St Paul's Church-Yard
notes: Text describes the cabbage trees on Juan Fernandez Island, a silver fish said to have a great bottle nose and delicious white flesh, and the port of Arica, including profiles of some mountains which surround it. William Dampier, circumnavigator and privateer, commanded the ship St. George on his third voyage (1703-1707) around the world. He did not publish a description of this voyage although one of his officers, William Funnell, described it in this work. It was during this voyage that Alexander Selkirk, a model for Daniel Defoe's Robinson Crusoe, was marooned on Juan Fernandez Island.

Image_title: [Native Americans look at treasures given them by Columbus and his men]
Description: Natives examine goods given them by Christopher Columbus and his men. One man holds a bell, another some sort of tool. Also includes ships and canoes or boats.
Source_Title: Naaukeurige versameling der gedenk-waardigste zee en land-reysen na Oost en West-Indiën ... zedert het jaar 1524 tot 1526

SubjectHeadings1: First contact of aboriginal peoples with Westerners

Image_title: [Vasco Núñez de Balboa receives gifts from Tumacco]
Description: Two European men stand next to a seated native American chief or cacique who has his people collect pearls to give to the Europeans. Includes ships and vessels or containers of European style.
Source_creator: Bellegarde, M. l'abbé de (Jean Baptiste Morvan), 1648-1734
Source_Title: [Histoire universelle des voyages] Histoire universelle des voyages faits par mer & par terre, dans l'ancien & dans le nouveau monde. ...
Source_publisher: Chez Pierre Humbert.
notes: Text states that Vasco Núñez de Balboa made friends with the cacique, Tumacco, and that in gratitude the chief made Balboa gifts of pearls. Balboa then offered to conquer an island in the Caribbean Sea ruled by Tumacco's enemies and to give the island to Tumacco. Balboa was the first European to see the Pacific Ocean from Central America, and he founded the settlement of Santa María la Antigua del Darién in present-day Panama in 1510.Bellegarde was a clergyman, author, and translator. He translated Bartolomé de Las Casas.Sometimes attributed to Du Perier de Montfraisier.
SubjectHeadings1: Indians of Central America--First contact with Europeans

Image_title: [Running Animal]
Description: An animal similar to a dog runs through a landscape.
Source_creator: Bellegarde, M. l'abbé de (Jean Baptiste Morvan), 1648-1734
Source_Title: [Histoire universelle des voyages] Histoire universelle des voyages faits par mer & par terre, dans l'ancien & dans le nouveau monde. ...
Source_publisher: Chez Pierre Humbert.
notes: Text describes this "monstrous" animal as having the body and head of a fox, the rear quarters and feet of a cat, and front legs similar to those of a man. It is mentioned in a section that seems to describe a trip to Patagonia (a country of large, nomadic people near the Antarctic) made by two of Columbus' crewmen in 1499.Bellegarde was a clergyman, author, and translator. He translated Bartolomé de Las Casas.Sometimes attributed to Du Perier de Montfraisier.

Image_title: [Virgin of Guadalupe]
Description: Our Lady of Guadalupe within a double-headed Hapsburg eagle. She stands on a cactus and is surrounded by two kneeling native Americans [?] and angels. Above her are two keys and the papal crown.
Source_creator: Catholic Church. Archdiocese of Mexico City (Mexico). Archbishop (1553-1572 : Montúfar)
Source_Title: Nos don Fr. Alonso de Montufar, Arçobispo de Mexico ...
notes: A vision of the Virgin of Guadalupe, with native American features, appeared to Juan Diego, a native American, on a hill named Tepeyac near the site of a temple to the Aztec goddess Tonantzin (Mother of the People) in 1531. Archbishop Zumárraga, the first archbishop of Mexico, accepted the vision when Juan Diego presented his cloak, or tilma, with the Virgin's image on it filled with out-of-season roses. Montufar, the second archbishop of Mexico, also was very instrumental in spreading the veneration of the Virgin of Guadalupe. Publication information from colophon.
SubjectHeadings2: Mary, Blessed Virgin, Saint--Apparitions and miracles--Mexico

Source_Title: Journal des observations physiques, mathematiques, et botaniques ... Tome premier
Source_publisher: Rue S. Jacques, chez Pierre Giffart, Libraire, Graveur du Roy, & de l'Académie Royale de Peinture & de Sculpture

Image_title: [Eagle eating snake on cactus]
Description: In an oval, an eagle eating a snake stands on a cactus which in turn grows around a castle.
Source_Title: Separacion y singularidad entre los veinte y sies prothomartires del Japon de San Felipe De Iesus, indiano, patricio, y Patron de Mexico. ...
Source_publisher: Por Francisco de Rivera Calderon, en la Calle de San Augustin
notes: Image (without castle) is now used as central motif in the Mexican flag. It derives from the legend that the Aztecs, looking for a homeland, were guided by the god Huitzilopochtli (god of the sun and war) to a place where an eagle perching on a cactus ate a snake. On this spot they founded Mexico City (Tenochtitlan).

Image_title: [top] La teste d'une Tortuë de Mer et l'Anatomie des pieces qui en composent l'oreille [bottom] Les oeufs et la Matrice de la Tortuë de Mer

Source_publisher: Chez Jean Mariette, ruë Saint Jacques, aux Colonnes d'Hercules

Image_title: [Caledonia Harbour and Coast Adjacent]
Description: Map of a harbor in Darien. Cartographic elements include compass rose, some topographical details and location of native American settlements, islands, and fort. Items in the image are lettered for identification in key on page adjacent.
Source_Title: Memoirs of Darien giving a short description of the countrey, with an account of the attempts of the Company of Scotland, to settle a colonie in that place ...
Source_publisher: Printed by Hugh Brown
notes: The Company of Scotland sent five ships carrying 1,200 people to Caledonia Bay in November 1698. The settlers constructed Fort Saint Andrew and began to erect the dwellings for New Edinburgh. A combination of heat, disease, lack of agriculture, and lack of support from the English government, caused the Scots' settlement to collapse. By July 1699, the colony was abandoned, and the 300 settlers who had survived returned to Scotland.Image title taken from preceding text.
SubjectArea1: Geography, maps, city views and plans

Image_title: [Native American holiday activities]
Description: A native American swings a crooked stick at a ball while a native American woman offers him a drink. In the background, a native American celebration is taking place guarded by Spaniards. In the foreground are a trumpet, a drum. a drinking dish with a long beak, and a whistle or pipe.
Source_Title: Relation du voyage de la mer du sud aux côtes du Chily et du Perou fait pendant les années 1712, 1713 & 1714.
Source_publisher: Chez Jean-Geoffroy Nyon ... Etienne Ganeau ... Jacque Quillau
notes: Text describes the Cahouin Touhan or drunkenness, a celebration involving days of constant drinking, singing, and dancing by the Chilean natives. Engraver is probably Nicolas Guerard, active from 1680 to 1719.
SubjectHeadings1: Indians of South America--Social life and customs

Image_title: [Spanish women of Peru]
Description: Three Spanish women prepare and consume a drink made from a herb. Different items of clothing peculiar to them are shown and are named in the key below the image.
Source_Title: Relation du voyage de la mer du sud aux côtes du Chily et du Perou fait pendant les années 1712, 1713 & 1714.
Source_publisher: Chez Jean-Geoffroy Nyon ... Etienne Ganeau ... Jacque Quillau
notes: Text discusses dress, dwellings, manners, and morals of the Spaniards in Peru.

Image_title: [Native American fisherman]
Description: Native South American [Chilean] paddling a raft made of seal skins sewn together and inflated. Also includes penguin, seal and inset diagram of raft and method of stitching.
Source_Title: Relation du voyage de la mer du sud aux côtes du Chily et du Perou fait pendant les années 1712, 1713 & 1714.
Source_publisher: Chez Jean-Geoffroy Nyon ... Etienne Ganeau ... Jacque Quillau
notes: Engraver is probably Nicolas Guerard, active 1680-1719.

Image_title: [Taking of the Nuestra Señora de la Encarnación y Desengaño]
Description: Naval battle between two ships or galleons with another ship in the background. Includes boat.
Source_Title: [Cruising voyage round the world. French] Voyage autour du monde, commencè en 1708 & fini en 1711. ... tome premier. Où l'on a joint quelques pièces curieuses touchant la riviere des Amazones & la Guiane.
Source_publisher: Chez la veuve de Paul Marret, dans le Beurs-straat à la Renommée
notes: At the end of December 1709 Rogers took one of the greatest prizes ever captured - the Manila galleon Nuestra Señora de la Encarnación y Desengaño. The ship was on its way from Manila to Acapulco full of treasure bound for Spain. Rogers was shot through the cheek and jaw during the battle.Woodes Rogers was an English privateer who during the War of the Spanish Succession harassed Spanish possessions in order to help protect English shipping. In the ships Duke and Duchess, he led a circumnavigation of the globe between 1708 and 1711. His pilot on this trip was William Dampier. In February of 1709, he picked up Alexander Selkirk from Juan Fernández Island where he had been marooned for five years. The voyage was instrumental in the foundation of the South Sea Company. In 1717 Rogers was appointed first royal governor of the Bahamas after which time he helped to suppress piracy.
Provenance_Donor: Napoleon I, emperor of the French; acquired in 1866.

Image_title: [Attack on Guayaquil, Ecuador]
Description: European men attack a walled city from ships and boats. Includes churches, guns or muskets, cannons, spears, and horns (musical instrument) with banners.
Source_Title: [Cruising voyage round the world. French] Voyage autour du monde, commencè en 1708 & fini en 1711. ... tome premier. Où l'on a joint quelques pièces curieuses touchant la riviere des Amazones & la Guiane.
Source_publisher: Chez la veuve de Paul Marret, dans le Beurs-straat à la Renommée
notes: Rogers' party attacked Guayaquil in April 1709. They first attempted to take the town by means of threats and bargaining, but used force when the leaders of the town proved to be bargaining treacherously. The town was plundered of its valuables which were then shared out as booty to the crews. Woodes Rogers was an English privateer who during the War of the Spanish Succession harassed Spanish possessions in order to help protect English shipping. In the ships Duke and Duchess, he led a circumnavigation of the globe between 1708 and 1711. His pilot on this trip was William Dampier. In February of 1709, he picked up Alexander Selkirk from Juan Fernández Island where he had been marooned for five years. The voyage was instrumental in the foundation of the South Sea Company. In 1717 Rogers was appointed first royal governor of the Bahamas after which time he helped to suppress piracy.
Provenance_Donor: Napoleon I, emperor of the French; acquired in 1866.

Image_title: [Santolina and Cytisus plants]
Description: The branches and individual flowers of the Santolina solis and Cytisus arboreus plants.
Source_Title: Relation du voyage de la mer du sud aux côtes du Chily et du Perou fait pendant les années 1712, 1713 & 1714.
Source_publisher: Chez Jean-Geoffroy Nyon ... Etienne Ganeau ... Jacque Quillau
notes: Text states that the Cytisus (Alvaquilla or in Indian, Culen) plant was used to cure sores, smells like sweet basil, and has white shading to violet flowers. It may be in the genus Genista. The Santolina may be related to green lavender cotton.

Image_title: [top] Cameleon de diverses couleurs. [bottom] Cameleon noir.
Description: [top] A chameleon. [bottom] A lizard or chameleon.
Source_Title: [Cruising voyage round the world. French] Voyage autour du monde, commencè en 1708 & fini en 1711. ... tome premier. Où l'on a joint quelques pièces curieuses touchant la riviere des Amazones & la Guiane.
Source_publisher: Chez la veuve de Paul Marret, dans le Beurs-straat à la Renommée
notes: Rogers' party visited Gorgona Island off the coast of present-day Colombia in August, 1709. Rogers noted the so-called lion lizards (chameleon means earth lion and is from the family Chamaeleonidae) that changed their colors.Woodes Rogers was an English privateer who during the War of the Spanish Succession harassed Spanish possessions in order to help protect English shipping. In the ships Duke and Duchess, he led a circumnavigation of the globe between 1708 and 1711. His pilot on this trip was William Dampier. In February of 1709, he picked up Alexander Selkirk from Juan Fernández Island where he had been marooned for five years. The voyage was instrumental in the foundation of the South Sea Company. In 1717 Rogers was appointed first royal governor of the Bahamas after which time he helped to suppress piracy.
Provenance_Donor: Napoleon I, emperor of the French; acquired in 1866.

Image_title: Le Paresseux.
Description: Sloth.
Source_Title: [Cruising voyage round the world. French] Voyage autour du monde, commencè en 1708 & fini en 1711. ... tome premier. Où l'on a joint quelques pièces curieuses touchant la riviere des Amazones & la Guiane.
Source_publisher: Chez la veuve de Paul Marret, dans le Beurs-straat à la Renommée
notes: Rogers' party visited Gorgona Island off the coast of present-day Colombia in August, 1709. Rogers observed the slow, "Clock-work," movement of the sloths that lived on the island. This sloth is probably Bradypus variegatus gorgon.Woodes Rogers was an English privateer who during the War of the Spanish Succession harassed Spanish possessions in order to help protect English shipping. In the ships Duke and Duchess, he led a circumnavigation of the globe between 1708 and 1711. His pilot on this trip was William Dampier. In February of 1709, he picked up Alexander Selkirk from Juan Fernández Island where he had been marooned for five years. The voyage was instrumental in the foundation of the South Sea Company. In 1717 Rogers was appointed first royal governor of the Bahamas after which time he helped to suppress piracy.Image placed horizontally on page.
Provenance_Donor: Napoleon I, emperor of the French; acquired in 1866.

Image_title: Habitans de la Plata ou Paragay et du Tucuman.
Description: Native American men with animals. The men wear feathered headdresses, capes, and skirts. Includes bows and arrows, lizard [iguana?], bird, and animal resembling a rhinoceros.
Source_Title: [Cruising voyage round the world. French] Voyage autour du monde, commencè en 1708 & fini en 1711. ... tome premier. Où l'on a joint quelques pièces curieuses touchant la riviere des Amazones & la Guiane.
Source_publisher: Chez la veuve de Paul Marret, dans le Beurs-straat à la Renommée
notes: Rogers notes the physical characteristics, customs, and behaviors of the native Americans of the area of the Rio della Plata, called the Tucuman by Rogers. They were "ruled" by Jesuits. The Tucuman, now known as the Diaguita, live in northwestern Argentina. Woodes Rogers was an English privateer who during the War of the Spanish Succession harassed Spanish possessions in order to help protect English shipping. In the ships Duke and Duchess, he led a circumnavigation of the globe between 1708 and 1711. His pilot on this trip was William Dampier. In February of 1709, he picked up Alexander Selkirk from Juan Fernández Island where he had been marooned for five years. The voyage was instrumental in the foundation of the South Sea Company. In 1717 Rogers was appointed first royal governor of the Bahamas after which time he helped to suppress piracy.
Provenance_Donor: Napoleon I, emperor of the French; acquired in 1866.

Image_title: La Cote de la Mer du Sud.
Description: Map of the west coast of Central America. Cartographic elements include compass rose, scale, lines of latitude and longitude, locations of settlements, volcanoes, and rivers.
Source_Title: [Cruising voyage round the world. French] Voyage autour du monde, commencè en 1708 & fini en 1711. ... tome second. Où l'on a joint quelques pièces curieuses touchant la riviere des Amazones & la Guiane.
Source_publisher: Chez la veuve de Paul Marret, dans le Beurs-straat à la Renommée
notes: Taken from a supplement called Supplément, ou description des côtes, ... depuis Acapulco ... jusques à l Isle de Chiloé, ...Woodes Rogers was an English privateer who during the War of the Spanish Succession harassed Spanish possessions in order to help protect English shipping. In the ships Duke and Dutchess, he led a circumnavigation of the globe between 1708 and 1711. His pilot on this trip was William Dampier. In February of 1709, he picked up Alexander Selkirk from Juan Fernández Island where he had been marooned for five years. The voyage was instrumental in the foundation of the South Sea Company. In 1717 Rogers was appointed first royal governor of the Bahamas after which time he helped to suppress piracy.
Provenance_Donor: Napoleon I, emperor of the French; acquired in 1866.
SubjectArea1: Geography, maps, city views and plans

Image_title: Plan de la Ville de Santiago ...
Description: Plan of the city of Santiago, Chile, showing locations of churches, religious orders, and municipal places and structures. Items are numbered and lettered for identification in a key within the image. Includes inset of a view of the mountain of St. Lucie. Also includes compass rose and scale.
Source_Title: Relation du voyage de la mer du sud aux côtes du Chily et du Perou fait pendant les années 1712, 1713 & 1714.
Source_publisher: Chez Jean-Geoffroy Nyon ... Etienne Ganeau ... Jacque Quillau
SubjectArea1: Geography, maps, city views and plans

Image_title: Plan de la Vile [sic] de Lima ...
Description: Plan of the city of Lima, Peru, showing locations of churches, chapels, and religious orders. Also shows gates to the city and notable municipal places. Includes scale and coat of arms. Items are lettered and numbered for identification in a key within the image.
Source_Title: Relation du voyage de la mer du sud aux côtes du Chily et du Perou fait pendant les années 1712, 1713 & 1714.
Source_publisher: Chez Jean-Geoffroy Nyon ... Etienne Ganeau ... Jacque Quillau
notes: Frézier may have drawn the plan. The coat of arms belongs to the city of Lima. They were granted in Valladolid on November 3, 1536. Lima was called the king's city by its Spanish conquerors.
SubjectArea1: Geography, maps, city views and plans

Image_title: Habitans du Perou

Image_title: Verda dela Efigie de el Y.Illmo. Exmo. y Venerable S. D. D. Manuel Ferandez de Sta. Cruz y Sahagun, Obpo de la Puebla d[e] los Angeles
Description: Portrait of Manuel Fernandez de Santa Cruz, y Sahagun, bishop of Puebla de los Angeles (1637-1699). Includes bishop's miters and book.
Source_Title: Dechado de principes ecclesiasticos, que dibujò con su exemplar, virtuosa, y ajustada vida el Illust. y Exc. señor doctor D. Manuel Fernandez de S. Cruz, y Sahagun. Collegial, que fuè, en el mayor de Cuenca, canonigo magistral en la iglesia de Segovia ... nombrado arçobispo de la metropolitana de Mexico, y virrey de esta Nueva España, honor que renunciò en vida
Source_publisher: En la Imprenta dela viuda de Miguel de Ortega y Bonilla
notes: Sor Juana de la Cruz wrote Respuesta a Sor Filotea de la Cruz in response to the bishop's writing under the pseudonym of Sor Filotea.
SubjectHeadings1: Fernández de Santa Cruz y Sahagún, Manuel, 1637-1699

Image_title: [Women and man on horseback]
Description: Two Spanish women, one with a cloak or mantilla over her head, the other seen from the back, stand before a creole of Peru on horseback in his traveling garments. Items in the image are lettered for identification in key at bottom.
Source_Title: [Relation du voyage de la mer du sud aux côtes du Chily et du Perou fait pendant les années 1712, 1713 & 1714. English] A voyage to the South-Sea, and along the coast of Chili and Peru
Source_publisher: Printed for Jonah Bowyer, at the Rose in Ludgate-street
notes: Engraver was probably Nicolas Guérard (son of Nicolas Guérard, ca. 1648-1719) who was active at the beginning of the eighteenth century.

Image_title: [Native Americans of Chile]
Description: Native American paddling a balsa raft. Also includes a view of the boat from the front, a diagram of the animal skin bladders and balsa rods which make up the raft and the manner in which it was put together, a penguin, and a seal or walrus on land. Also includes inset diagram of raft and method of stitching. Items in the image are lettered for identification in key below.
Source_Title: [Relation du voyage de la mer du sud aux côtes du Chily et du Perou fait pendant les années 1712, 1713 & 1714. English] A voyage to the South-Sea, and along the coast of Chili and Peru
Source_publisher: Printed for Jonah Bowyer, at the Rose in Ludgate-street
notes: Engraver was probably Nicolas Guérard (son of Nicolas Guérard, ca. 1648-1719) who was active at the beginning of the eighteenth century.

Image_title: [Native Americans of Chile]
Description: A native American woman from Chile grinds corn or maize to make flour, a man wears a poncho and holds a rope, a woman holds a plant stalk and bottle, another man lassoes cattle while riding a horse. Items idenified in key below.
Source_Title: [Relation du voyage de la mer du sud aux côtes du Chily et du Perou fait pendant les années 1712, 1713 & 1714. English] A voyage to the South-Sea, and along the coast of Chili and Peru
Source_publisher: Printed for Jonah Bowyer, at the Rose in Ludgate-street

Image_title: [Mercury processing and llamas]
Description: A native American woman from Chile grinds corn or maize to make flour, a man wears a poncho and holds a rope, a woman holds a plant stalk and bottle, another man lassoes cattle while riding a horse. Items idenified in key below.
Source_Title: [Relation du voyage de la mer du sud aux côtes du Chily et du Perou fait pendant les années 1712, 1713 & 1714. English] A voyage to the South-Sea, and along the coast of Chili and Peru
Source_publisher: Printed for Jonah Bowyer, at the Rose in Ludgate-street

Image_title: [Inca or Indians of Peru]
Description: Inca and his queen with a child holding a parasol are flanked by a native American man and woman who offer gifts. The queen holds a bird on a string. Built environment includes native dwellings. Artifacts include a type of stove and three vessels found in graves of ancient Indians. Includes lettered key for identification. Also includes mantilla and ornaments.
Source_Title: [Relation du voyage de la mer du sud aux côtes du Chily et du Perou fait pendant les années 1712, 1713 & 1714. English] A voyage to the South-Sea, and along the coast of Chili and Peru
Source_publisher: Printed for Jonah Bowyer, at the Rose in Ludgate-street
notes: Key states that the Inca and Coia [queen] were drawn from a picture made by the Indians of Cuzco.The stove is used to cook a herb. Engraver was probably Nicolas Guérard (son of Nicolas Guérard, ca. 1648-1719) who was active at the beginning of the eighteenth century.

Image_title: [Fish of Chile]
Description: Various fish, sea horse, sawfish, and a crustacean or lobster from Chile. Includes a barracuda [?], a sawfish seen from the bottom and from the side, a seahorse, a pejegallo or elephant fish.
Source_Title: [Relation du voyage de la mer du sud aux côtes du Chily et du Perou fait pendant les années 1712, 1713 & 1714. English] A voyage to the South-Sea, and along the coast of Chili and Peru
Source_publisher: Printed for Jonah Bowyer, at the Rose in Ludgate-street
notes: Scientic name of the pejegallo (elephantfish or cockfish) is Callorhinchus callorynchus. Scie (sawfish or carpenter shark) are from the family, Pristiformes. Engraver was probably Nicolas Guérard (son of Nicolas Guérard, ca. 1648-1719) who was active at the beginning of the eighteenth century.

Image_title: Fraise du Chili dessinée degrandeur naturelle
Description: Strawberry plant showing fruit and leaves. Also includes an illustration of the mountain flax or Nancolahui.
Source_Title: [Relation du voyage de la mer du sud aux côtes du Chily et du Perou fait pendant les années 1712, 1713 & 1714. English] A voyage to the South-Sea, and along the coast of Chili and Peru
Source_publisher: Printed for Jonah Bowyer, at the Rose in Ludgate-street
notes: Amédée Frézier was a French royal military engineer under contract to the Spanish government. He introduced one of the ancestors of the modern strawberry to France, where it was known as the "fraise du Chili." Engraver was probably Nicolas Guérard (son of Nicolas Guérard, ca. 1648-1719) who was active at the beginning of the eighteenth century.
References_exhibitions: Slive, D.J. A Harvest Gathered, Item 9

Image_title: La vie de Gregoire Lopez
Description: Gregorio Lopez holds a book at which he points. Includes a tree and beam of light.
Source_Title: [Vida que hizo el siervo de Dios Gregorio López. French] Le saint solitaire des Indes, ou La vie de Gregoire Lopez ...
Source_publisher: Chez Jean de la Pierre
notes: A hermit known for his erudition, Lopez was a physician in colonial Mexico during the last half of the sixteenth century. He is known to have written Tesoro de medicinas, a textbook on the mysteries and errors of medicine in Mexico, and a treatise on the Apocalypse or Revelations.

Image_title: [Native Americans of Chile]

Image_title: [Native Americans of South America]
Description: A native American woman prepares cornmeal or maize with grinding tools [manos and metates], and native American men sit on a balsa raft. In the background a man lassos cattle, people dance in a circle, and people watch a game. Also includes a volcano erupting, a ship, a crustacan [lobster?], a seal, swordfish, war club, spear, paddles, feathered headdesses, shells, and strawberry plant [?].

Image_title: [Native Americans play ball]
Description: A native American swings a crooked stick at a ball while a native American woman offers him a drink. In the background, a native American celebration is taking place guarded by men on horseback. In the foreground are a trumpet, a drum, a drinking dish with a long beak, and a whistle or pipe.
